Topic.Title: Sales Tax impact on Amazon

Message.Msg: Just based on personal opinion. I use amazon because it has great selection. Most alternative sources have less selection. Brick and mortar stores definitely have less selection and other online merchants have a smaller selection and will still charge sales tax as well. So Amazon still wins. However I see a slowing growth trend which could hurt the share price. But from my view of the chart the support level is 220 assuming it breaks through 240 relatively fast. At 220 this stock is more reasonably priced. I am not a holder, just waiting.

Topic.Title: Amazon now up significantly more than AAPL over the past two years...

Message.Msg: What I know about is true economic value creation and value capture, which has little to do with the current functioning of the stock market. Today's market is driven by WS's need for trading profits. It is being run for churn to try to generate the cash flow to perpetuate that which cannot be sustained. Rather than making the necessary adjustments, the Fed continues to pursue policies to enable the current model for a little while longer, all while undermining INVESTMENT in productive assets (which are typically illiquid and thus not where the money is going). Sybs is correct that stock multiples have changed in a statistically significant way since the introduction of weekly options. The best investments based upon fundamentals have been systematically repressed and the most speculative float jam #$%$ has seen multiple expansion. The move by so many institutional longs to generate returns by selling options has exacerbated the discrepancy. As a result, the market is actually sending signals that reward value destruction rather than value creation, all in the interest of trading profits... This will end VERY badly, Much worse than anyone anticipates now because WS will never be able to regain the trust of the public this time. Capital will be pulled from the capital markets and held in cash, physical gold and our investment model will increasingly localize again. I am playing for the long haul Geeg. Not the short term.

Topic.Title: Amazon now up significantly more than AAPL over the past two years...

Message.Msg: But, on an enterprise value basis, the comparison is MUCH more egregious. Apple has grown its net cash by about 70B from year end 2010 to year end 2012. That accounts for about 75% of the increase in market cap over the period. Amazon, in contrast, grew its cash+ST investments from about $9B to $11B, but took on $3B in LT debt -- in other words, no net increase in net cash. Someday, the trading scam being run between these stocks will get the attention it deserves...

Topic.Title: OK I'm a fool but I short AMZN !

Message.Msg: Greenspan was on last week saying the only thing that matters is that the stock market holds. Why? Because the banks (enabled by the Fed and the spread of assets over liablities that ZH always discusses and POMO/QE4EVAH) have been selling vol and buying the market to create the "wealth effect" and restore the economy. The problem is financial assets are too concentrated for that to work. Housing has a much higher powered wealth effect, but housing cannot be manipulated easily (much tougher to centrally control). It isn't about the economy. It is about trying to protect the banks and the system as it stands. But, the sector has captured a disproportionate share of economic rents for essentially trading stocks (not a societal value creating activity) for decades. When society focuses its resources on activities that are at best value neutral rather than value creating, decline is a certainty. We've been at it for decades now as the economy is grown through financial measures rather than real investments in (illiquid but) productive assets. There is a way out of this mess without catastrophic outcomes (that's where I focus all of my mental energy), but we are headed for catastrophe right now.

Message.Title: AAPL book equity growth versus Amazon... Even more evidence of a broken market...
Message.Msg: Again, Amazon's stock has outperformed AAPL over the past 2 years. So, how has Amazon grown book equity over the period (which cannot be manipulated by the float jam option scam) versus AAPL? Book equity at year end 2010 and year end 2012: Amazon: 6.8B (2010) and 8.2B (2012) -- an increase of a little more than 20% Apple: 47.7B (2010) and 118.2B (2012) -- an increase of a little less than 150% Yet, Amazon's stock has outperformed Apple's because someone (IMHO) has been painting the tape and our reflexive technical trading driven markets have taken both of them way beyond where either should have gone... Wreaks of future scandal...

Topic.Title: It took a few yearz, but the optionz scam iz so blantantly obvious to retailerz that ....

Message.Msg: Sybs: One can statistically show that the option float jam scam has systematically held back certain companies and expanded valuations into lala land for others. More institutional longs are deriving more of their returns from the option scalping game and as such, not applying traditional investment rules to changes in positions... Somebody on this board made the assertion returns from option activity was treated differently in terms of fund manager comp and fund shareholder benefit than traditional returns. I am not aware of that being the case, but if it is, there are profound issues. Anyone who knows info on the subject, please email my alias. If it is true, there is a profound conflict of interest driving this activity that needs to have some light shined on it. The btards have made it worth my while to expose all this #$%$.

Message.Title: Treatment of options income in funds....

Message.Msg: What your missing iz weekly optionz scam + montly option scam + LEAP option scam + good ol fashion short run of the mill short squeeze + unlimited money supply fed to prop up the scam companiez able to pull easy money low interest bondz + scam leveraged etfs that use all of theze = much bux for a robot to statistically to fix a worthless stok, or keep a dog stok barking and yapping. Theze fvck in idiots are making a killing, and ben iz garaunteeing it.

Topic.Title: Treatment of options income in funds....

Message.Msg: Sybil asked a similar question of sybs broker and was told : The scrape from the option scam goes directly to the fund manager as a part of at risk compensation. Its not reported in the fundz income avail to fund holderz. Its off the books.

Topic.Title: It took a few yearz, but the optionz scam iz so blantantly obvious to retailerz that ....

Message.Msg: It isn't just the weekly, as longer term options also trade daily. But, on an apples to apples basis, more shares traded via options today than the underlying itself. In fact, more shares traded in the two weekly contracts than total shares. Roughly 14K 2/22 calls, 16K 2/22 puts, 6K 3/1 calls and 7.5K 3/1 puts for a total of 4.3MM shares of underlying versus 3.1MM shares traded. Bigger spreads and decay make it more profitable if you control enough underlying to move the price for a period of time. If you look back at how all the puts that were kept out of the money in the November to Janaury short and put squeeze, it represented A LOT of shares and A LOT of money.

Topic.Title: Treatment of options income in funds....

Message.Msg: If that is true then this is gonna get big. Real big.

You guessed it 450-600 .... Then sybil will go long under lying dogz that survive.... The s&p on confidence rattled to the core will put great stox on sale az the s&p tradez at 4-6x earningz. They have circumvented this by 'creating' sharez that dont exist in the scam optionz market. WAKE THE FVCK UP people.

Topic.Title: It took a few yearz, but the optionz scam iz so blantantly obvious to retailerz that ....

Message.Msg: Sybs: There is counterparty risj in virually all financial assets. Many of those contracts are spreads, but like all derivates, one cannot net in a cascading default... If the big boys don't start letting the air out gradually and soon, that is where we are headed.
